org.lazywizard.lazylib.ui.LazyFont.DrawableString

Packages that use LazyFont.DrawableString
Package
Description
org.lazywizard.lazylib.ui
Contains classes and methods for rendering text and simple GUI elements.

  • Uses of LazyFont.DrawableString in org.lazywizard.lazylib.ui

    Method
    Description
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.DrawableString.append(String text)
    Adds additional text to the end of the current text.
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.DrawableString.append(String text, Color color)
    Adds a colored substring to the end of the current text.

    Adds a colored substring to the end of the current text, with indentation.
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.createText()
    Create a LazyFont.DrawableString with no text, ready for appending.
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.createText(String text)
    Create a LazyFont.DrawableString with the specified initial text.

    Create a LazyFont.DrawableString with the specified initial text and color.
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.createText(String text, Color baseColor, float size)
    Create a LazyFont.DrawableString with the specified initial text, color, and font size, with no text wrapping.
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.createText(String text, Color baseColor, float size, float maxWidth)
    Create a LazyFont.DrawableString with the specified initial text, color, and font size, with text wrapping.
    LazyFont.DrawableString
    LazyFont.createText(String text, Color baseColor, float size, float maxWidth, float maxHeight)
    Create a LazyFont.DrawableString with the specified initial text, color, and font size, with text wrapping and a max height - any appended text past that limit will be discarded.
